title: New on Peacock in February 2026 : All the new shows and movies to watch
body_text:
New on Peacock in February 2026: All the new shows and movies to watch
'The Burbs,' Super Bowl LX and more
Here at Tom’s Guide our expert editors are committed to bringing you the best news, reviews and guides to help you stay informed and ahead of the curve!

Looking for something good to watch this February? Peacock has plenty of new additions this month, from reality TV, wall-to-wall sports, and plenty of must-watch events packed into just a few weeks.
Near the beginning of February and throughout the month, sports fans have plenty to circle on the calendar, as Legendary February brings together the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics, Super Bowl LX, and the NBA All-Star Game in one nonstop stretch.
Then, for anyone craving dark comedy and suspense, "The 'Burbs" serves it up with a remake of the '80s classic starring Tom Hanks with Keke Palmer taking the lead role instead.
Finally, there's the season 4 finale of "The Traitors", followed by its reunion special, where plenty of secrets finally come to light. Yes, that means more drama as well.
There’s plenty more arriving throughout the month, but these highlights are the perfect place to start. Below, you’ll find everything coming to Peacock in February 2026. Check it out and plan your watchlist accordingly.
New on Peacock in February 2026: Top picks
Legendary February: Milan Cortina Winter Olympics, Super Bowl LX, and NBA All-Star Game
Things kick into high gear from February 6–22 with Legendary February, a massive stretch where three of the biggest moments in sports take over at once. You've got three separate events going on, all available to watch via Peacock. The Milan Cortina Winter Olympics bring world-class competition to the global stage, while Super Bowl LX is all about football’s biggest showdown of the year.
At the same time, the NBA All-Star Game brings basketball action to an already packed February, so if you're into sports or just want to be part of history with all the spectacles, these days are your opportunity to jump in and see what happens. It's a can’t-miss run for sports fans, no matter which league has your loyalty.
Get instant access to breaking news, the hottest reviews, great deals and helpful tips.
Stream on Peacock starting February 6-22
'The 'Burbs'
In this remake of the 1989 film of the same name, a young couple (Keke Palmer and Jack Whitehall) reluctantly move into the husband’s childhood home. But when a mysterious new neighbor arrives across the street, strange behavior and some super freaky secrets begin bubbling to the surface.
Soon, the couple realizes their neighborhood may be hiding far more than some weirdly awkward block parties and nosy residents. Their seemingly safe version of suburbia won't last long, and they've got to figure out how to get out or die trying.
Stream on Peacock starting February 8
'The Traitors' season 4 finale and reunion
The tension reaches its breaking point with the season 4 finale of "The Traitors", followed immediately by its reunion show. The Emmy Award-winning reality series brings all of its action to a head as the remaining players deal with all their lies, betrayals, and alliances from the inside of the show's Scottish Highlands castle. Host Alan Cummings will return to showcase it all as well.
The Faithful have one final prize on the line, so they're forced to scramble and expose the last Traitors. Meanwhile, the deceivers have to survive one final banishment. Once the game ends, you can watch the reunion show to see how everything actually played out behind the scenes for more incredibly juicy drama.
Stream on Peacock on February 26
Peacock originals and exclusives in February 2026
- January 26: The Office Superfan Episodes, Premiere, Season 9 (Peacock Exclusive)*

Brittany Vincent has been covering video games and tech for over 13 years for publications including Tom's Guide, MTV, Rolling Stone, CNN, Popular Science, Playboy, IGN, GamesRadar, Polygon, Kotaku, Maxim, and more. She's also appeared as a panelist at video game conventions like PAX East and PAX West and has coordinated social media for companies like CNET. When she's not writing or gaming, she's looking for the next great visual novel in the vein of Saya no Uta. You can follow her on Twitter @MolotovCupcake.
